title: If you're going to permaban my account, give me my money back.
body: I don't give a shit if you permaban me, but I spent real money on this game, and now I can't even play it anymore. i deserve my money back at the very least.

I had an account wrongfully perma banned as well. And this account was recently the victim of an unjust chat restriction. The lessons I’m learning.
1. I do not and will not ever purchase RP again.
2. I try to mute all the chat, pings and emotes before I even leave the starting spot and buy starting items. This way I don’t give my team the chance to flame.
3. I have learned to not gank lanes if they are feeding. They won’t stop feeding if you gank them, just feed when you are gone. If whole team is feeding, I ignore them and try to get something moving solo.
4. Don’t bother reporting inters or trolls. RIOT wont’t ban them, only you if you say something to them. Try to not get worked up over them (this is hard).
5. Don’t be affraid to ff @15. I used to never ff, then my main account got banned. Now I’ll vote yes on one if I’m even mildly annoyed.

This is a work in progress.

Why do you call yourself a 5 percenter if you have no interest in reforming?

Same reason the hells angels and Vets call themselves 1%ers and 3%ers. That was on a chat ban saying only 5% were toxic enough to get ban, whoever wrote that doesn’t actually play the game. Someone actually told me to “go kys” I told them to shut the f@&$ up. I got a ban for telling a bully to shut up, so I changed my name to that. I never once drew first blood.

Counter flaming is still flaming. I'm sure the logs between the ban and chat restriction are different, but you are negative and condescending enough in the chat restriction games for it to warrant the punishment. Also worth noting you were punished for more than just those three games, they were just the most recent examples.

> Don’t bother reporting inters or trolls. RIOT wont’t ban them...

Source? 'Cause I've seen a sparing handful of Boards posts now and again showing players who did get banned for feeding. So either you're misinformed, or the people claiming to have been banned for feeding are lying, and I'm disinclined to trust you on this.
Several matches where I was matched with a troll ir inter in back to back matches. I’ve sent in tickets about this, but was blown off. So personal experiance is my source. Take it or leave it.

Personal experience isn't a valid source. You claim that Riot doesn't ban players who intentionally feed, but look at [this post](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/A7qmX7iU-would-like-to-appeal-a-14-day-suspension-for-intentionally-feeding). The player in question was banned for feeding, and very clearly admits that they did.

Or, another, take [this post](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/GrmPK5yP-intentional-feeding-but-i-didnt-feed) as an example, too. The player here claims they were falsely banned, but several people (including myself) pointed out holes in their story and proved them to be lying.

You can tell yourself that Riot doesn't ban intentional feeders all you like, but that doesn't make it true. You can cite your personal experience as a source (which, personal experience and lack of response from tickets/reports is literally nothing to go off of), but it's never really going to match up to _actual proof_.

Proof which I gave you two examples of. Even one could have sufficed, but two, I believe, has a better chance of hammering the message home.

TL;DR - I'll leave your source, because it's biased and unreliable in the face of actual case examples contrary to your claims.
Um, cool story bro. But how is that anymore valid? I’ll stick with my experiance. You can stick with the one or two times they might have actually banned one inter or troll.

> But how is that anymore valid?

Because these are people who actually got banned, not the experience of someone who wouldn't know if a player they reported got punished or not.

Granted, both require the belief that what the person in question (in your case, you, in my case, the two punished players) is saying is true, but, with that in mind, I'm more willing to believe two cases where players say they got banned over someone saying "Riot doesn't ban people for this" without anything to back up their claim.

(besides, i highly doubt people would come to the boards and be dishonest about getting punishments - sure, they'll be dishonest about _why_ they got punished, but I've yet to see someone lie about the level of punishment they got.)

> You can stick with the one or two times they might have actually banned one inter or troll.

Correction: _Did_ actually ban. Not "might have".

I'm not going to tell you what to believe, but I'm not inclined to let you spread misinformation, either. Riot _does_ ban intentional feeders and trolls, whether you see it or not. Those two forum posts I linked very clearly attest to that fact.
Do whatever makes you happy, but calling your chat restriction "unjust" is just baseless whining. I read your logs, you were constantly insulting your team across multiple games.
Enjoy your ban. I'll be over here able to play the game because I'm not a piece of shit in society :^)
